names.japanese: ニーア オートマタ

data.name: [A]
data.rules:
#**Global Rules**

**You may submit your time as one or both of these:**
- Loadless timing (PC only): 
    - The leaderboards are sorted by this. This requires an [autosplitter](https://www.speedrun.com/NieR_Automata/guide/a0yhf) and active recording of LiveSplit's IGT (loadless) timer **throughout the entire run**. If loadless timer is not visible or LiveSplit crashes/visually freezes/etc, RTA time will be used.
- RTA timing (all platforms):
    - DOES NOT REQUIRE recording LiveSplit or timer.
    - Console Runs:
    - [A] console runs faster than 1:40:00 RTA will have their loads timed out manually by the verification team.
    - [A] console runs slower than or equal to 1:40:00 RTA will have a blanket time of 2min 35 sec removed and that new time will be used as their loadless time, REGARDLESS of language and hardware.

**While not required for speedruns, if [FAR](https://www.speedrun.com/NieR_Automata/guide/dpqew) is used, you must comply with the following:**
- Must be version 0.5.2.X or above.
- Must have framerate capped at 60.
- Must show frame counter throughout run. (Compatibility Settings > Debugging > Log Level slider set to 1)
- Must at least show FAR Title/Clock at beginning and end of run. (On Screen Display > Basic Monitoring > Check the Title/Clock box) 
Please note that use of the ReShade integration feature with FAR is BANNED.

**While not required for speedruns, if [NARoIP](https://www.speedrun.com/na/guide/dwn52) is used, you must comply with the following:**
- Must be version 0.0.2 or above.
- The text “NARoIP[XXXXX]” must be visible in the game window. This text will appear automatically when the mod is active and installed.

**Rulings on other known mods are as follows:**
- DS4 Button Prompts are BANNED.
- Windows Borderless Gaming is BANNED.
- NieR Automata Input Overhaul Mod (NAIOM) is BANNED.
- [VC3Mod](https://github.com/jackalstomper/AutomataSpeedrunMod/releases) is ALLOWED in only the VC3Mod, Mackerel and Prologue categories. For every other category it is BANNED.
- _ALL_ other mods are explicitly BANNED

**Input modifications must comply with the following:**
1. All player inputs must be mapped to no more than one (1) game input each. (Many buttons that do one action are allowed. One button to do many actions is banned. Use of Macros & ‘Turbo’ functions are STRICTLY BANNED)
2. Changing how inputs behave through on-the-fly modifications outside of in-game menus is BANNED.
3. Button and joystick deadzone / actuation point modifications are allowed, so long as points 1 & 2 are still met.

**Submissions must also comply with the following:**
- Game version must be the latest for your platform or region.
- Video is required, MUST show the selection of NEW GAME from the Title Screen, show the creation of the save file, and if on PC the Loadless timer from LiveSplit must be shown.
- Loading another save file during the run is not allowed.
- Changing the language mid-run is OK.
- Pre-run setups like Voice Changer and [Skype glitch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3_afCUq34zE) are not allowed.

#**A Ending Rules**

- Timing begins upon pressing “Start Game”.
- Timing ends when the final 2B and 9S cutscene begins before ending [A].
- If using the autosplitter, the timer MUST start with a 2.18 seconds off-set when auto-starting.
- VC3mod is BANNED.
- Connecting to the Network is not allowed.

last updated 2020-06-06

names.japanese: ニーア オートマタ

data.name: Prologue
data.rules:
#**Global Rules**

**You may submit your time as one or both of these:**
- Loadless timing (PC only): 
    - The leaderboards are sorted by this. This requires an [autosplitter](https://www.speedrun.com/NieR_Automata/guide/a0yhf) and active recording of LiveSplit's IGT (loadless) timer **throughout the entire run**. If loadless timer is not visible or LiveSplit crashes/visually freezes/etc, RTA time will be used.
- RTA timing (all platforms):
    - DOES NOT REQUIRE recording LiveSplit or timer.
    - Console Runs:
    - Prologue console runs will be re-timed during the verification process to provide a loadless time.

**While not required for speedruns, if [FAR](https://www.speedrun.com/NieR_Automata/guide/dpqew) is used, you must comply with the following:**
- Must be version 0.5.2.X or above.
- Must have framerate capped at 60.
- Must show frame counter throughout run. (Compatibility Settings > Debugging > Log Level slider set to 1)
- Must at least show FAR Title/Clock at beginning and end of run. (On Screen Display > Basic Monitoring > Check the Title/Clock box) 
Please note that use of the ReShade integration feature with FAR is BANNED.

**While not required for speedruns, if [NARoIP](https://www.speedrun.com/na/guide/dwn52) is used, you must comply with the following:**
- Must be version 0.0.2 or above.
- The text “NARoIP[XXXXX]” must be visible in the game window. This text will appear automatically when the mod is active and installed.

**Rulings on other known mods are as follows:**
- DS4 Button Prompts are BANNED.
- Windows Borderless Gaming is BANNED.
- NieR Automata Input Overhaul Mod (NAIOM) is BANNED.
- [VC3Mod](https://github.com/jackalstomper/AutomataSpeedrunMod/releases) is ALLOWED in only the VC3Mod, Mackerel and Prologue categories. For every other category it is BANNED.
- _ALL_ other mods are explicitly BANNED

**Input modifications must comply with the following:**
1. All player inputs must be mapped to no more than one (1) game input each. (Many buttons that do one action are allowed. One button to do many actions is banned. Use of Macros & ‘Turbo’ functions are STRICTLY BANNED)
2. Changing how inputs behave through on-the-fly modifications outside of in-game menus is BANNED.
3. Button and joystick deadzone / actuation point modifications are allowed, so long as points 1 & 2 are still met.

**Submissions must also comply with the following:**
- Game version must be the latest for your platform or region.
- Video is required, MUST show the selection of NEW GAME from the Title Screen, show the creation of the save file, and if on PC the Loadless timer from LiveSplit must be shown.
- Loading another save file during the run is not allowed.
- Changing the language mid-run is OK.
- Pre-run setups like Voice Changer and [Skype glitch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3_afCUq34zE) are not allowed.

#**Prologue Rules**

- Timing begins upon pressing “Start Game”.
- Time ends at the start of the cutscene after you defeat Engels.
- If using the autosplitter, the timer should be set to start with a 2.18 seconds off-set when auto-starting.
- Connecting to the Network is not allowed.

last updated 2020-06-06

data.name: Mackerel
data.rules:
#**Global Rules**

**You may submit your time as one or both of these:**
- Loadless timing (PC only): 
    - The leaderboards are sorted by this. This requires an [autosplitter](https://www.speedrun.com/NieR_Automata/guide/a0yhf) and active recording of LiveSplit's IGT (loadless) timer **throughout the entire run**. If loadless timer is not visible or LiveSplit crashes/visually freezes/etc, RTA time will be used.
- RTA timing (all platforms):
    - DOES NOT REQUIRE recording LiveSplit or timer.
    - Console Runs:
    - Mackerel console runs will be re-timed to provide a loadless time during the verification process.

**While not required for speedruns, if [FAR](https://www.speedrun.com/NieR_Automata/guide/dpqew) is used, you must comply with the following:**
- Must be version 0.5.2.X or above.
- Must have framerate capped at 60.
- Must show frame counter throughout run. (Compatibility Settings > Debugging > Log Level slider set to 1)
- Must at least show FAR Title/Clock at beginning and end of run. (On Screen Display > Basic Monitoring > Check the Title/Clock box) 
Please note that use of the ReShade integration feature with FAR is BANNED.

**While not required for speedruns, if [NARoIP](https://www.speedrun.com/na/guide/dwn52) is used, you must comply with the following:**
- Must be version 0.0.2 or above.
- The text “NARoIP[XXXXX]” must be visible in the game window. This text will appear automatically when the mod is active and installed.

**Rulings on other known mods are as follows:**
- DS4 Button Prompts are BANNED.
- Windows Borderless Gaming is BANNED.
- NieR Automata Input Overhaul Mod (NAIOM) is BANNED.
- [VC3Mod](https://github.com/jackalstomper/AutomataSpeedrunMod/releases) is ALLOWED in only the VC3Mod, Mackerel and Prologue categories. For every other category it is BANNED.
- _ALL_ other mods are explicitly BANNED

**Input modifications must comply with the following:**
1. All player inputs must be mapped to no more than one (1) game input each. (Many buttons that do one action are allowed. One button to do many actions is banned. Use of Macros & ‘Turbo’ functions are STRICTLY BANNED)
2. Changing how inputs behave through on-the-fly modifications outside of in-game menus is BANNED.
3. Button and joystick deadzone / actuation point modifications are allowed, so long as points 1 & 2 are still met.

**Submissions must also comply with the following:**
- Game version must be the latest for your platform or region.
- Video is required, MUST show the selection of NEW GAME from the Title Screen, show the creation of the save file, and if on PC the Loadless timer from LiveSplit must be shown.
- Loading another save file during the run is not allowed.
- Changing the language mid-run is OK.
- Pre-run setups like Voice Changer and [Skype glitch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3_afCUq34zE) are not allowed.

#**Mackerel Rules**

- Eat a Mackerel. 
- Timer starts when you hit "Start Game".
- Time stops on the first frame that "aji wo [K]utta" (ending [K]) appears on the screen.
- If using the autosplitter, the timer MUST start with a 2.18 seconds off-set when auto-starting.
- VC3Mod V1.5 is allowed but not required. If VC3Mod V1.5 is used, a legitimate Mackerel (not a fished item replaced by the mod) must be obtained before eating a Mackerel.
- Connecting to the Network is not allowed.

last updated 2020-06-06

data.name: Tutorial
data.rules:
Complete the tutorial from start to finish.

Survivor: Timer starts when you close the first pop-up box (and the okay just starts to grey out) and the timer ends when you escape the map. (As soon as your hands disappear into the hatch is when the timer ends.)

Killer: Timer starts when you close the first pop-up box and the timer ends when you hook the last survivor.

Full: Both tutorials must be completed in one sitting. The difference between the end of the first tutorial and the start of the second will be taken out of the final time due to inconsistent load times. The run may not be spliced and has to be completed in one sitting.

RTA timing is required, so no pausing the timer at any point is allowed.

(A form of timing is now mandatory for milliseconds. Implemented in 2019)

**Any form of Macros are not allowed;**

- This includes wiggle/struggle macro
- Killer AFK macro

data.name: Tutorial
data.rules:
Complete one of the three available parts of the tutorial as fast as possible using in-game time. Timing ends when dealing the final blow to the nexus.

Accounts level must be shown at every video, either beginning or the end, all run without this validation will be rejected.

Accounts below level 11 are banned.

If the video of the run is uploaded via the replay, the speed must not excel x2 at all time.

As of 04/26/16, all runs require video proof and IGT must be shown at in the video.
